body:
### Description

Context: Most of the CPU time is spent in [`zeromem`](https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/edf8869ff27b5dd16a61067842a38c1c5fa6273b/vendor/github.com/mutecomm/go-sqlcipher/zeromem.c)

At least on M1 macs most of the time is spent resetting the stack to 0 after sha1 compression. Removing the [`LTC_CLEAN_STACK `]( https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/e7fbc191f4916f5801704ed9b6a06c738019a73e/vendor/github.com/mutecomm/go-sqlcipher/tomcrypt_custom.h#L114) define speeds up the app and improves the CPU usage.


There are 2 issues with the current implementation used in status-go:
1. The stack is not properly cleaned on `arm64`. See https://github.com/libtom/libtomcrypt/issues/486
The `burn_stack` implementation is reported as being broken in tomcrypt lib and it's disabled by default.
```
#if defined(LTC_CLEAN_STACK)
/* if you're sure that you want to use it, remove the line below */
   #error LTC_CLEAN_STACK is considered as broken
#endif
```

2. `burn_stack` is slow on `arm64`. It weights about 50% of total CPU time.
